intro: Cryptantha leiocarpa var. hispidissima, commonly known as the hairy cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its hairy stems and leaves are distinctive features that help it retain moisture in dry conditions. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
